properties.abstract: When climbing Arête du Verdy to Hochmatt, the names on the right-hand side are French, and on the left-hand side they are German. This is the invisible line separating the French and German speaking parts of Switzerland. The ridge brings us to a magnificent pasture with a splendid view.  The highest chalet in the canton of Fribourg formerly stood in this pasture. Today, it is in ruins. The tour has a language theme because we visit two summits, one with a French name and the other a German one.
properties.subtitle: The "Röstigraben" (dig) is a "Röstiridge" (ridge)
properties.title: Arête du Verdy – Hochmatt – Cheval Blanc

sac_photos.title: Arête du Verdy above Pointe de Tosse
On the ascent on Arête du Verdy
Hochmatt: the summit pasture with the view to Gastlosen
View from Hochmatt to Cheval Blanc
On the descent from Cheval Blanc to Petit Mont

segments.description: From Im Fang follow the hiking trail to Bi Chalet. After leaving the village, the trail is on the forested N side. From Bi Chalet either follow the road or hike in pastures directly up to the hut at P. 1348. The trail continues via Rustoz, traversing the two elevations of Pointe de Tosse (P. 1750 and P. 1771, unnamed on the map) on the west side. Finally, you reach a saddle above the chalet at Le Verdy (1693 m). The two Pointe de Tosse can also be climbed.
segments.title: Im Fang – Pointe de Tosse – Le Verdy

segments.description: Follow the entire ridge, forested at first, then interspersed with rocky outcrops, to reach the flat SW ridge. Always keep to the right of the ridge line. In a few steps you reach the highest point (2151 m). The summit cross, which is well visible from Im Fang, is on a less high promontory further east.
segments.title: Le Verdy – Arête du Verdy – Hochmatt

segments.description: There are two possible descents. Both are marked blue-white and almost equally long: the direct descent via «In den Löchern» (see variant 1) or via Cheval Blanc, if you want to add another summit. In this case traverse the summit pasture eastward via P. 2089 to ascend the Cheval Blanc summit (2146 m). From the summit a path descends the E ridge until ca. 1920 m, where you leave the ridge to descend the SE face to Schänis (ca. 1420 m) and the road.
segments.title: Hochmatt – Cheval Blanc – Schänis

segments.description: Slightly below Schänis the two routes merge. Follow the road back to Im Fang, cutting short some of the bends on a hiking trail.
segments.title: Schänis – Im Fang

segments.description: From the summit cross traverse the pasture to reach the ruins of the old chalet (ca. 2030 m), then descend on the E ridge. You reach the karst terrain of «In den Löchern». Follow a trail down to the road at Petit Mont; T4.
segments.title: Variant 1: descent from via In den Löchern

segments.description: From Hochmatt you can descend the SW ridge on a marked trail (T2) to reach Haut du Mont (1365 m) on the N edge of the wide Gros Mont high plain. There is a rustic mountain restaurant at Le Sori (ca. 1393 m), 2 km south of the parking lot at Haut du Mont. As the descent from Gros Mont to Pra Jean on the road from Jaun to Charmey is unattractive, this variant comes into play, when you want to spend the night at Cabane des Marindes (1868 m).
segments.title: Variant 2: descent from Hochmatt to Cabane des Marindes via Gros Mont
